Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: Seems like this is a core KMD bug

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @zatJUM so, after talking with James a bit, I have a few ideas. Either try a fresh sync (get rid of datadir) or try a -reindex and see if that changes stuff. A previous error (maybe Hush coredumped a while ago?) might have corrupted some data

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: this especially happened to me with zaddrs recently

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: a coredump or other bad error, will break the state of our zaddrs and your wallet will think you are trying to double spend, until you reindex

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: because it never got to say "this zutxo is spent" and write out the data

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: What I have learned recently is that `-reindex` fixes many sins, but some can only be fixed with a resync, such as some coredumps or `kill -9` issues where data is not written correctly

Author: zatJUM#9924
Content: It's ok. All synchronized and running. Let's wait for the 1rst nota for 11 days on hush3 üò´

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @zatJUM that is very good to hear! Now I know to recommend people a fresh sync if this ever happens. Most likely a previous coredump or `kill -9` got your datadir into an inconsistent state

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: thank you very much for reporting the bug, it's still very good to know things work for you. And what to suggest others who run into this
